summary: "Charlie's Angels," an American crime drama, aired from 1976 to 1981 with 115 episodes over five seasons. Created by Ivan Goff and Ben Roberts, it followed three women detectives in Los Angeles, originally played by Kate Jackson, Farrah Fawcett, and Jaclyn Smith. Their boss, Charlie Townsend, was an unseen character voiced by John Forsythe. Despite mixed reviews and a focus on the leads' sex appeal, it was a top ten hit for its first two seasons. The show spawned movies, a reboot series, and a cult following, continuing its popularity through syndication and DVD releases.
title: Charlie's Angels
